Common GL functions¶

Provides common GL functionality.

pygly.gl.set_scissor(rect)[source]¶

Calls glScissor with the size of the rectangle.

Note

It is up to the user to call glEnable(GL_SCISSOR_TEST).

Note

To undo this, call this function again with the window’s size as a rectangle.

See also

Module pygly.window Documentation of the pygly.window module.

pygly.gl.set_viewport(rect)[source]¶

Calls glViewport with the dimensions of the rectangle

pygly.window.aspect_ratio(rect)[source]¶

Calculates the aspect ratio of the rectangle.

Aspect ratio is the ratio of width to height a value of 2.0 means width is 2*height

Returns:
The aspect ratio of the rectangle.
pygly.window.create_rectangle(window)[source]¶

Creates a rectangle object representing the window size in pixels.

Returns:
The size of the window in pixels represented as a NumPy array with shape (2,2).
